title: Some dogs can pick up hundreds of words – do they learn like children?
content: Pixel-Shot/Shutterstock Imagine Max, a well-trained border collie, manages to ignore a squirrel in the park when his owner tells him to sit. His owner says, “Max, stop chasing that squirrel and sit down,” and Max obeys. Can dogs learn and understand words the way humans do? A new study found dogs like Max may have learnt the names of objects (like a squirrel) from overhearing their owners talking.
